bill.title: Relating To Address Confidentiality.
bill.description: Changes the governmental entity responsible for the administration of the address confidentiality program from the Department of the Attorney General to the Office of the Lieutenant Governor. (HB1433 CD1)

history.action: Introduced and Pass First Reading.
Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Thursday, 02-07-19 2:05PM in House conference room 325.
The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 02-08-19.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Friday, 02-08-19 2:00PM in conference room 325.

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 9 Ayes: Representative(s) C. Lee, San Buenaventura, Brower, Creagan, Lowen, Morikawa, Say, Takayama, Yamane; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) McKelvey, Thielen.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 312) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to FIN.
Deferred one day 02-13-19.

Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, McDermott, Nakamura, Ward excused (4).
Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Thursday, 02-21-19 1:30PM in House conference room 308.

The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 14 Ayes: Representative(s) Luke, Cullen, Eli, Gates, Hashimoto, Holt, Kitagawa, B. Kobayashi, Matayoshi, Nakamura, Nishimoto, Wildberger, Yamashita, McDermott; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Todd.
Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 834), recommending passage on Third Reading.
Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) DeCoite excused (1). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 123).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to JDC, WAM.
The committee(s) on JDC has scheduled a public hearing on 03-14-19 9:30AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDC recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in JDC were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) K. Rhoads, Wakai, Gabbard, Kim; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Fevella.
Reported from JDC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1286) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading and referral to WAM.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
The committee(s) on WAM will hold a public decision making on 04-04-19 10:35AM in conference room 211.

The committee(s) on WAM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in WAM were as follows: 12 Aye(s): Senator(s) Dela Cruz, English, Harimoto, Inouye, K. Kahele, Kanuha, Kidani, Moriwaki, Riviere, Shimabukuro, Taniguchi, Fevella; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Keith-Agaran.
Reported from WAM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2021) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 1).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-09-19.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 25; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 860) in amended form (SD 1).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 804).
House Conferees Appointed: C. Lee, Gates Co-Chairs; Thielen.
Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 808).
Senate Conferees Appointed: K. Rhoads Chair; Riviere Co-Chair; Fevella.
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 948).
Bill scheduled for Conference Committee Meeting on Wednesday, 04-24-19 3:30PM in conference room 325.
Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Thursday 04-25-19 3:20PM in conference room 325.
Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday 04-26-19 3:20PM in conference room 325.

The Conference Committee recommends that the measure be Passed, with Amendments. The votes were as follows: 3 Ayes: Representative(s) C. Lee, Gates, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 0 Excused: none.

The Conference committee recommends that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes of the Senate Conference Managers were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) K. Rhoads, Riviere, Fevella; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from Conference Committee (Conf Com. Rep. No. 137) as amended in (CD 1).
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 04-30-19.
Reported from Conference Committee as amended CD 1 (Conf. Com. Rep. No. 137).
48 Hrs. Notice (as amended CD 1) 04-30-19.
Passed Final Reading as amended in CD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
Passed Final Reading, as amended (CD 1). Ayes, 25; Aye(s) with reservations: none . 0 No(es): none. 0 Excused: none.
Received notice of Final Reading (Sen. Com. No. 968).
Received notice of passage on Final Reading in House (Hse. Com. No. 883).
Transmitted to Governor.
Became law without the Governor's signature, Act 274, 07/10/2019, (Gov. Msg. No. 1394).
